snippet: Workers at the Volkswagen plant in Chattanooga, Tenn., had voted against joining the United Automobile Workers.
abstract: Volkswagen labor officials in Germany renew calls for company's three-year-old plant in Chattanooga, Tenn, to establish German-style works council even though its workers voted against joining the United Automobile Workers; work council is common in German factories in which white-collar and blue-collar workers elect representatives to establish policies.
lead_paragraph: Workers at the Volkswagen plant in Chattanooga, Tenn., had voted against joining the United Automobile Workers.

headline.main: Labor Regroups in South After VW Vote
headline.print_headline: Labor Regroups in South After VW Vote
